_description: [The Romance of] Sir Otuel — in couplets

BodDou376.First Lines:
Herkneþ boþ ȝunge and oldeþat willen heren of
                    batailles bolde…
BodDou376.Last Lines:
…And for his lond rente ȝiueWiþ þe none he mote
                    liue

NLS1921.First Lines:
HErkneþ boþe ȝinge & oldeþat willen heren
                    of batailles bolde…
NLS1921.Note:
1738 lines in this MS, many folios mutilated; ends imperfectly due to
                    lost leaves, and last extant folio (277v) virtually illegible.
                    Nineteenth-century transcript in Oxford,  Bodleian Library Douce 376 (SC 21951), f. 1.
NLS1921.Facsimiles:
Pearsall,  Derek,  and  I. C. Cunningham, eds.  
             The Auchinleck Manuscript. National Library of Scotland
                Advocates’ MS. 19.2.1.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.
NLS1921.Editions:
Turnbull,  William Barclay David Donald,
                        ed.  
             The Romances of Rouland and Vernagu, and Otuel from the Auchinleck
                Manuscript.
Abbotsford Club
         4. Edinburgh, 1836: 31-84.
Herrtage,  Sidney John Hervon,
                        ed.  
             The English Charlemagne Romances VI: The Taill of Rauf Coilyear, with
                the fragments of Roland and Vernagu and Otuel.
EETS
         e.s. 39 (1882); repr. 1969:  65-116.
